thread.title: Education Secretary Arne Duncan steps down after 7-year term
thread.title_full: Education Secretary Arne Duncan steps down after 7-year term - San Francisco Chronicle

title: Education Secretary Arne Duncan steps down after 7-year term
text: Photo: Pablo Martinez Monsivais, AP President Barack Obama pats Education Secretary Arne Duncan's back in the State Dining Room of the White House in Washington, Friday, Oct. 2, 2015, as Duncan announced that he will be stepping down in December after 7 years in the Obama administration. Duncan will be returning to Chicago and Obama has appointed senior Education Department official, John King Jr., to oversee the Education Department. President Barack Obama pats Education Secretary Arne Duncan's back... WASHINGTON (AP) — President Barack Obama is reluctantly accepting the resignation of Education Secretary Arne Duncan, saying he's earned the right to return home as one of the longest-serving secretaries in the department's history. President Barack Obama pats Education Secretary Arne Duncan's back in the State Dining Room of the White House in Washington, Friday, Oct. 2, 2015, as Duncan announced that he will be stepping down in December after 7 years in the Obama administration. Duncan will be returning to Chicago and Obama has appointed senior Education Department official, John King Jr., to oversee the Education Department. President Barack Obama pats Education Secretary Arne Duncan's back... WASHINGTON (AP) — President Barack Obama is reluctantly accepting the resignation of Education Secretary Arne Duncan, saying he's earned the right to return home as one of the longest-serving secretaries in the department's history.
